content:
Sokolów Malopolski has never been part of Ukraine. The town is located in southeastern Poland, in the Podkarpackie Voivodeship, and has been part of various Polish territories throughout its history.

However, the border between Poland and Ukraine has shifted several times over the centuries, and there have been periods when Sokolów Malopolski was located close to the border. During World War II, the town was occupied by Nazi Germany, and after the war, it was part of Soviet-controlled Poland. However, it has always been part of the Polish state and has never been part of Ukraine.
